article_title: Highmark Calls Rate Info Requests A Burden In Antitrust Fight
article_text:
Highmark Calls Rate Info Requests A Burden In Antitrust Fight

Law360, Los Angeles (March 18, 2016, 9:02 PM ET) -- Highmark Inc. said Thursday that a special master got it wrong and handing the company an unfair burden when it recommended the insurer turn over years of details about its pricing rates to a hotel chain in a proposed antitrust class action accusing the insurer of inflating its prices.



Special Master Richard A. Levie said in a report to U.S. District Judge Joy Flowers Conti this month that Pittsburgh hotel operator Cole’s Wexford Inc. may seek discovery about Highmark rates charged between 1999 and 2001, 2008...
